Evil [dwarves](/Ancestries.aspx?ID=1) who die having failed to live up to the exacting standards of the [duergar](/MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=38) god [Droskar](/Deities.aspx?ID=28) are sometimes forced to return to the material world as undead abominations known as forge-spurned. Forge-spurned look like dwarves with pupilless eyes and leathery flesh, and with their hair and beard made of smoke and fire—newly formed forge-spurned can almost be mistaken for living creatures as a result. The longer forge-spurned exist, the more skeletal and fiery their visage becomes; those who have existed for centuries or more often look as if they have skulls for faces and fire for hair. **[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 22 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 20 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 17 [Forge-Spurned](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2181) **Source** [Crown of the Kobold King](/Sources.aspx?ID=148) pg. 119, [Pathfinder #148: Fires of the Haunted City](/Sources.aspx?ID=13) pg. 83 **Perception** +11; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** [Common](/Languages.aspx?ID=1), [Dwarven](/Languages.aspx?ID=3), [Undercommon](/Languages.aspx?ID=11) **Skills** [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +14, [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) +14, [Droskar Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +12 **Str** +5 **Dex** +2 **Con** +4 **Int** +1 **Wis** +2 **Cha** +0 **Items** [_soul chain_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1737), [warhammer](/Equipment.aspx?ID=24) --- **AC** 22 **Fort** +15 **Ref** +9 **Will** +11 **HP** 75 (eternal damnation, [negative healing](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=42)) **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Weaknesses** [cold](/Traits.aspx?ID=27) 5 **Eternal Damnation** ([divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) As long as their _soul chain_ remains intact, a forge-spurned can't be truly destroyed. They rise again fully healed at the next sundown, even if their physical body was destroyed.
**Searing Heat** ([fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72)) A creature who touches a forge-spurned (including by [Grappling](/Actions.aspx?ID=35) them or hitting them with an [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=199) attack) takes 2d6 fire damage with a DC 21 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. --- **Speed** 20 feet **Melee** _soul chain_ +15 ([Disarm](/Traits.aspx?ID=175), [Trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=196)), **Damage** 2d8+5 slashing plus 1d6 fire **Melee** warhammer +14 ([Shove](/Traits.aspx?ID=193)), **Damage** 1d8+7 bludgeoning **Inflate Bellows** **Requirements** The forge-spurned has used Forge Breath; **Effect** The forge-spurned draws a massive breath to refill their emptied lungs, enabling them to use Forge Breath again. **Forge Breath** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72)) The forge-spurned breathes a cloud of stinging soot, ash, and glowing embers. This can affect either a 30-foot cone or a 20-foot burst centered on the forge-spurned and persists for 1d4 rounds. Each creature that moves into or starts their turn in the area takes 6d6 fire damage, with a DC 21 [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Reflex save. A creature who fails its save is also [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1) for 1 minute. Creatures within the cloud are [concealed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=4), though not from the forge-spurned. The forge-spurned can't use Forge Breath again until they've used Inflate Bellows. **Soul Chain** ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) If a creature is slain by an attack from the _soul chain_ and the forge-spurned is able to retain the creature's corpse, they can bind the creature's soul into a _soul chain_ (as [_bind soul_](/Spells.aspx?ID=21)) with a day of work at a forge and a successful DC 20 [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4) check. An individual whose soul is bound in this way can't be resurrected unless the _soul chain_ is destroyed (Hardness 5, HP 20, BT 10).
Haunted Forges Forge-spurned are often encountered near abandoned forges, and the presence of these undead dwarves can infest that forge with an ever-burning fire. Such “haunted” forges burn without the need for fuel, though they extinguish automatically when their forge-spurned source is destroyed.
Soul Chains A forge-spurned wields a soul chain: a cursed _+1 [striking](/Equipment.aspx?ID=280) [flaming](/Equipment.aspx?ID=295) [spiked chain](/Weapons.aspx?ID=60)_. Any other creature that has a _soul chain_ must succeed at a DC 22 Will save each day at sundown or transform into a forge-spurned permanently. A forge-spurned stops at nothing to retrieve its _soul chain_ if it’s lost.
name: Forge-Spurned
